info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 18 at 11:18AM MST until December 21 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 7 inches possible. Northeast winds 20 to 35 mph could cause blowing snow and could significantly reduce visibility Wednesday morning. Wind chills down to 35 below zero could impact valley areas Wednesday morning. * WHERE...Butte, Georgetown Lake, Highway 12 Garrison to Elliston, Homestake Pass, and MacDonald Pass. * WHEN...From Tuesday evening through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible.. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind chills as low as 35 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
